intro: Bicornella alborubra, commonly known as the red-brown bicorn, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and is known for its distinctive reddish-brown coloration in its stems and leaves. Bicornella alborubra produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it is often found in dry, open environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
